adjective.description: Without possessions; poor, destitute. Also: that does not have something specified. Also as noun: a destitute person; (with the) destitute people as a class. rare after Middle English.
Scottish. Of words, speech, etc.: having no meaning or significance; empty. Now chiefly literary.
English regional (Lincolnshire). Badly behaved, ill-mannered, rude.
Scottish and English regional (midlands). Lacking resourcefulness; helpless, incapable, incompetent.

origin: Old English. Originally (i) from Old English haefen the action or fact of having something, possession, property + -less; with the first element compare Old Icelandic hǫfn, in the same sense.
